basic-information.What is the purpose of the AP placement?: Public protection, Prevent contact with known individuals or victims, Help individual readjust to life outside of custody, Increased monitoring of risk factors

oasys-import.R10.1: Who is at risk:
[R10.1] IN CUSTODY

KNOWN ADULTS:
Such as Ms Elaine Underhill and any of the victims of the index offence if they are placed close to Mr Smith cell.

CHILDREN:
Simon Smith, Roger Smith, Lindy Smith
oasys-import.R10.2: What is the nature of the risk:
[R10.2] IN CUSTODY:

KNOWN ADULTS:
Intimidation, threats of violence, use of weapons or boiling water, physical education and violent assault, long term psychological impact as a result of Mr Smith violent behaviour. This harm may be cause in the course of physical altercation due to seeking revenge or holding grudges...
oasys-import.R10.3: When is the risk likely to be the:
[R10.3] STATIC RISK FACTORS:

Mr Smith gender - At the time of the offence, Mr Smith was 35 years old and considered to be in the higher risk group.

STABLE DYNAMIC RISK FACTORS:
Thinking and behaviour - limited ability to manage mood or emotions poor impulse control. Mr Smith demonstrated cognitive deficit in committing the index offences and this still remains a concern...

A lack of stable accommodation
unemployment
non constructive use of time
breakdown of family support
being unable to access benefits

UNDERLYING FACTORS:
pro criminal attitudes supporting commission of crime...

oasys-import.RM28: Further considerations: [RM28] Mr Smith is currently on remand awaiting sentence
oasys-import.RM28.1: Key information about current si: [RM28.1] Currently on remand at HMP Wandsworth - Management of case under MAPPA - level not yet set.
oasys-import.RM30: Supervision: [RM30] Probation Officer, Education training and employment Officer, Prison Offender Supervisor
oasys-import.RM31: Monitoring and control: [RM31] State they will have secure accommodation for Mr Smith  and partner on release, although she too is subject to a DRR at present. Supportive wider family.  Has completed previously Short Duration programme and attended one of the support sessions .  Engaged with CARATS in custody.  Complied with voluntary drug tests in custody. Some motivation to desist from alcohol/drug use in the future, this needs to be encouraged with use of community resources. Completed drug and heroin awareness programmes in custody.
oasys-import.RM32: Interventions and treatment: [RM32] Requires referral to community drug DIP upon  release. To link in with employment/training resources such as College and ETEO. Completion of victim empathy module via 1-1 supervision to build upon awareness of impact of offending.   Level setting to be undertaken by Senior Probation Officer and OMU. Multi Agency Public Protection Panel to be convened if level 2 either at start of supervision or 6 months prior to release
oasys-import.RM33: Victim safety planning: [RM33] Undertake sentence planning with OS within 8 or 16 weeks of sentence carats - continue to work with Mr Smith and refer for relevant programmes during any prison sentence imposed. DIP supervise DRR is imposed or provide support post release if conditions/requirements to manage the specific risks.
oasys-import.RM34: Contingency plans: [RM34] Discuss any concerns with line manager/SPO Increase frequency of reporting Bring forward MAPPA/Consider Level 2 MAPPA professionals meetings  considered if MAPPA not applicable. Consider referral to Approved Premises Consider motivational interviewing/engagement officer.  Joint interview with police OM or other relevant agencies? To raise concerns Referral to substance misues worker for additional support. Warning letters to be employed Recall/Breach if risk not manageable.

risk-management-features.Describe why an AP placement is needed t: Mr Bertrand's movements need to be monitored especially at night to ensure that he does not make content with previous victims.
risk-management-features.Provide details of any additional measur: Mr Bertrand should be tested for drug use regularly as he has been known to conceal this in the past.

risk-management-features.Which of the rehabilitative activities w: Drugs and alcohol, Children and families, Education, training and employment, Attitudes, thinking and behaviour, Abuse
risk-management-features.Provide a summary of how these intervent: Mr Bertrand must continue to address the behaviour which has led to offending in the past. These activities will support him in avoid reoffending.

location-factors.Give details of why this postcode area w: Mr Bertrand's family live in Otley and his sister is in Tadcaster. After a successful AP placement, he plans to move in with one or other, depending on circumstances and the progress which has been made.
location-factors.Provide details of any restraining order: Mr Bertrand must avoid the Old Trafford area, where the index offence was committed.

access-and-healthcare.Is the person eligible for COVID-19 vacc: Yes - Mr Bertrand was 65 in Oct 2023

further-considerations.Do you have any concerns about the perso: Yes - Mr Bertrand has a history of influencing others.
further-considerations.Is there potential for the person to ben: Yes - Mr Bertrand has benefitted from sharing cell and from increased social contact. Be aware of his history of influencing cell mates.

further-considerations.Is there any evidence or expectation tha: Yes - Mr Bertrand has a history of influencing others to participate in offences to obtain opiates

further-considerations.How has the person demonstrated their mo: Mr Bertrand has been on DART and demonstrated progress
further-considerations.How is the person planning to continue t: Mr Bertand has committed to joining the local AA in Leeds.

move-on.Why does this person require a different: This has been stipulated by the Parole Board Dec 12, 2023

move-on.Are move on arrangements already in plac: No - Mr Bertrand intends to move in with either this sister in Tadcaster or his own family in Otley
